## Description {#details}

Iterates through instructions in a set of blocks in reverse order from the first non-terminator.

For example (assume all blocks have size n): <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-gvnsink-cpp-/lockstepreverseiterator">LockstepReverseIterator</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I(&#91;B1, B2, B3&#93;)</a>; &#42;I– = &#91;B1&#91;n&#93;, B2&#91;n&#93;, B3&#91;n&#93;&#93;; &#42;I– = &#91;B1&#91;n-1&#93;, B2&#91;n-1&#93;, B3&#91;n-1&#93;&#93;; &#42;I– = &#91;B1&#91;n-2&#93;, B2&#91;n-2&#93;, B3&#91;n-2&#93;&#93;; ...

It continues until all blocks have been exhausted. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> <code><a href="#a1c19d8d16ee457dda6fed85074c4b02a">getActiveBlocks()</a></code> to determine which blocks are still going and the order they appear in the list returned by operator&#42;.

Definition at line 111 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/gvnsink-cpp">GVNSink.cpp</a>.
